docs.lead_paragraph: Patients who use medical marijuana for pain and other chronic symptoms can take an unwanted hit: Insurers don't cover the treatment, which costs as much as $1,000 a month.

headline.main: Health Insurers Just Say No to Marijuana Coverage
headline.print_headline: Health Insurers Just Say No to Marijuana Coverage

docs.snippet: Patients who use medical marijuana for pain and other chronic symptoms can take an unwanted hit: Insurers don't cover the treatment, which costs as much as $1,000 a month.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus opened in Hartford on Thursday, four days after an acrobatic stunt went awry, injuring nine performers and abruptly halting the circus in Providence, Rhode Island.

headline.main: While Injured Acrobats Recover, Circus Goes On
headline.print_headline: While Injured Acrobats Recover, Circus Goes On

docs.snippet: Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus opened in Hartford on Thursday, four days after an acrobatic stunt went awry, injuring nine performers and abruptly halting the circus in Providence, Rhode Island.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's nominee for health secretary drew support from Republican senators Thursday even as they challenged the health law she would be charged with carrying out.

headline.main: HHS Nominee Faces GOP Questions on Health Law
headline.print_headline: HHS Nominee Faces GOP Questions on Health Law

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama's nominee for health secretary drew support from Republican senators Thursday even as they challenged the health law she would be charged with carrying out.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Health Secretary-nominee Sylvia Mathews Burwell sought to allay a major Republican worry about Obamacare on Thursday, telling lawmakers that President Barack Obama's reforms would not lead to a government-run single-payer healthcare system on her watch.

headline.main: Burwell Seeks to Allay Republican Fears About Obamacare
headline.print_headline: Burwell Seeks to Allay Republican Fears About Obamacare

docs.lead_paragraph: Health insurance executives summoned to a House hearing Wednesday refused to go along with any G.O.P criticism of the health care law, undercutting some arguments against it.

headline.main: Called by Republicans, Health Insurers Deliver Unexpected Testimony
headline.print_headline: Called by Republicans, Health Insurers Deliver Unexpected Testimony

docs.abstract: Half-dozen health insurance executives summoned to House hearing refuse to go along with any Republican criticism of the health care law, undercutting some of lawmakers' arguments against it; predictions of fallout from law continue to fail to materialize.
docs.snippet: Health insurance executives summoned to a House hearing Wednesday refused to go along with any G.O.P criticism of the health care law, undercutting some arguments against it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hobby Lobby International has almost the same name as a far larger and socially polarizing company. Experts recommend rebranding.

headline.main: A Small Brand Tries to Escape the Confusing Shadow of a Big Brand
headline.print_headline: A Small Brand Tries to Escape the Confusing Shadow of a Big Brand

docs.abstract: You're the Boss blog; Hobby Lobby International owner Mark A Cleveland has had to address problem of being confused with Hobby Lobby Stores Inc due to the larger company's lawsuit over the Affordable Care Act's contraception provision; Cleveland has sought to force Hobby Lobby Stores to leave the hobby business altogether or compensate his company for rebranding.
docs.snippet: Hobby Lobby International has almost the same name as a far larger and socially polarizing company. Experts recommend rebranding.
